extendedIngredients.name: bread
extendedIngredients.original: 6 (3/4-inch-thick) slices of bread from 1 (7- to 8-inch) round country loaf
extendedIngredients.originalName: (3/4-inch-thick) slices of bread from 1 (7- to 8-inch) round country

extendedIngredients.name: canned chickpeas
extendedIngredients.original: 1 (19-ounce) can chickpeas, rinsed and drained (2 cups)

title: Bruschette with Chickpea Purée and Arugula
summary: Bruschette with Chickpea Purée and Arugula might be just the main course you are searching for. One serving contains 2001 calories, 75g of protein, and 35g of fat. This recipe serves 6 and costs $2.89 per serving. A mixture of arugula salad, lemon juice, olive oil, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so flavorful. To use up the bread you could follow this main course with the Coffee Cake Banana Bread as a dessert. It is a good option if you're following a vegan diet. This recipe is liked by 1 foodies and cooks. With a spoonacular score of 87%, this dish is super. Similar recipes include Chickpea Puree with Fennel Salad, Hummus (chickpea & Tahini Purée), and Merguez with Chickpea Purée and Eggplant Jam.
instructions: Preparation                                        Make toasts:                Put oven rack in middle position and preheat oven to 425°F.                                                                Arrange bread slices in 1 layer on a large baking sheet and brush top of each with 1 teaspoon oil. Bake until golden, about 12 minutes.                                                            Make chickpea purée:                Slip off skins from chickpeas with your fingers (discard skins). Blend chickpeas, water, oil, lemon juice, and salt in a food processor until very smooth (mixture will appear whipped).                                                            Assemble bruschette:                Spread toasts with chickpea purée and serve topped with arugula salad.

steps.step: Put oven rack in middle position and preheat oven to 425°F.
Arrange bread slices in 1 layer on a large baking sheet and brush top of each with 1 teaspoon oil.
Slip off skins from chickpeas with your fingers (discard skins). Blend chickpeas, water, oil, lemon juice, and salt in a food processor until very smooth (mixture will appear whipped).
Spread toasts with chickpea purée and serve topped with arugula salad.
